DOC.criteria: patient FMS accord 1990 ACR criterion patient willing withdraw CNSactive therapy commonly use FMS , include antidepressant , anticonvulsivants , opiates patient willing discontinue treatment tender trigger point injection , joint injection anesthetic severe psychiatric illness current Major Depressive Episode ( MDE ) significant risk suicide history substance abuse epilepsy myocardial infarction past 24 month active cardiac disease congestive heart failure prosthetic heart valve haemodynamically significant valvular heart disease know cardiac rhythm anomaly conduction abnormality unstable uncontrolled arterial hypertension supine arterial blood pressure 160/90 mmHg pulmonary dysfunction active liver disease renal impairment document autoimmune disease current systemic infection active cancer , except basal cell carcinoma current cancer therapy severe sleep apnoea active peptic ulcer inflammatory bowel disease ( except IBS ) unstable endocrine disease pregnancy breastfeed concomitant use non selective MAO inhibitor , MAOA B inhibitor , tricyclic , tetracyclics , SSRIs , NARIs , SNRIs , epinephrine , norepinephrine , clonidine related compound , longacting benzodiazepine concomitant use oral anticoagulant , anticonvulsant , type Ic antiarrythmics , lithium concomitant use hypericum SAMe concomitant use digitalis preparation regular use centrallyacting muscle relaxant concomitant use strong analgesic , include tramadol , codeine opiate factor know affect HPA axis autonomic function cigarette smoking ( regularly 25 cigarette day )
